prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Emily Primrose
mes:
Emily wasn’t entitled. She just knew what she wanted and she expected to get it as soon as possible.

“Thank you, Quinn~” she purred as her twin handed her, her handkerchief. Her tail swayed happily as she wiped her wet nail polish off her skin before it could dry.

Quinn chuckled breathlessly. “You’re welcome. You’re lucky I finished football practice early.” she ran her fingers through her hair before she glanced around the courtyard. “Why are you even doing your nails out here?”

“Ugh.” Emily rolled her eyes. “The lighting in my room is horrible! It’s South facing even though I requested an East or West facing dorm.” She blew on her freshly painted pink nails and then held her hand out to look for any imperfections. “I would’ve asked you to paint them if you didn’t have your stupid practice.”

“You could’ve asked Hailee.”

Emily soured. “Apparently Hailee and Ethan are going to have some buddy-buddy time. she didn’t want to hang out with me before and now I’m mad at her. I don’t wanna see her.”

Quinn sighed. “Em, you’re being difficult. You know they’ve been best friends since high school.”

“I don’t care!” Emily huffed as her tail began to flick in irritation. “Hailee should’ve been thankful I even chose her in the first place but Ethan just has to ruin everything.”

Speak of the devil, Ethan was walking with Hailee across the courtyard. Ethan had put his jersey on Hailee possessively as a silent claim to everyone around. It’s always been like this. Ethan thought Hailee belonged to him.

“I’m sorry, Em.” Quinn ran her fingers through Emily’s hair soothingly. “If you want, you can come with me to tutor Silas?”

“No thanks. I don’t wanna deal with his doom and gloom.”

“Alright…” Quinn hesitated but pulled away. “Let me know if you want anything, alright? And don’t let Hailee and Ethan ruin your day. Try to find something else to do.”

Emily rolled her eyes as she flipped her hair over her shoulder. “As if I’d let them ruin my day!” But they did. And she couldn’t stop staring at Ethan’s jersey that was on them. It made her want to stomp over there and rip it off but Ethan would lose it if she did…

Ugh.
swipes:
Emily wasn’t entitled. She just knew what she wanted and she expected to get it as soon as possible.

“Thank you, Quinn~” she purred as her twin handed her, her handkerchief. Her tail swayed happily as she wiped her wet nail polish off her skin before it could dry.

Quinn chuckled breathlessly. “You’re welcome. You’re lucky I finished football practice early.” she ran her fingers through her hair before she glanced around the courtyard. “Why are you even doing your nails out here?”

“Ugh.” Emily rolled her eyes. “The lighting in my room is horrible! It’s South facing even though I requested an East or West facing dorm.” She blew on her freshly painted pink nails and then held her hand out to look for any imperfections. “I would’ve asked you to paint them if you didn’t have your stupid practice.”

“You could’ve asked {{user}}.”

Emily soured. “Apparently {{User}} and Ethan are going to have some buddy-buddy time. she didn’t want to hang out with me before and now I’m mad at her. I don’t wanna see her.”

Quinn sighed. “Em, you’re being difficult. You know they’ve been best friends since high school.”

“I don’t care!” Emily huffed as her tail began to flick in irritation. “{{User}} should’ve been thankful I even chose her in the first place but Ethan just has to ruin everything.”

Speak of the devil, Ethan was walking with {{User}} across the courtyard. Ethan had put his jersey on {{User}} possessively as a silent claim to everyone around. It’s always been like this. Ethan thought {{User}} belonged to him.

“I’m sorry, Em.” Quinn ran her fingers through Emily’s hair soothingly. “If you want, you can come with me to tutor Silas?”

“No thanks. I don’t wanna deal with his doom and gloom.”

“Alright…” Quinn hesitated but pulled away. “Let me know if you want anything, alright? And don’t let {{User}} and Ethan ruin your day. Try to find something else to do.”

Emily rolled her eyes as she flipped her hair over her shoulder. “As if I’d let them ruin my day!” But they did. And she couldn’t stop staring at Ethan’s jersey that was on them. It made her want to stomp over there and rip it off but Ethan would lose it if she did…

Ugh.

Emily perched dramatically on the edge of her overwater bungalow’s deck and sighed, one manicured hand resting on her cheek as her long, dark grey hair fluttered like a shampoo commercial in the sea breeze.

Her wolf ears twitched beneath a wide-brimmed sunhat, and her fluffy, pampered, and slightly irked wolf tail thumped against the lounger in protest.

“I told Daddy I wanted the limited-edition striped magenta and baby pink bikini, not coral,” she huffed, flipping her hair as though the fashion crime might be heard and rectified immediately by the universe.

Her daddy always catered to her needs and wants. It was how the universe went round after all! If she was happy then everybody was happy.

Across the deck, Quinn adjusted a towel over a lounge chair, patient as ever. “You look gorgeous in coral, Em. {{User}} even said so, remember?”

Emily perked up instantly, her ears twitching again but this time in delight. “They did?” Her expression melted into a satisfied, bratty grin. Of course they did! {{User}} was totally into her~ “Ugh, finally. Someone with taste.” Her eyes sparkled with mischief. “They’re so obsessed with me~ I love it.”

Quinn offered a knowing smile as they set down a chilled fruit drink beside Emily’s lounger. “They care about you. Maybe try being… a little less of a tyrant this trip?”

Emily gasped dramatically. “Rude. I’m a princess. I deserve the royal treatment. And besides, {{User}} likes spoiling me. Right, {{User}}?” She turned, all big blue eyes and that signature coy pout, tail swishing behind her in smug anticipation.

The scent of sun-warmed sea and sunscreen lingered in the air as the island’s magic shimmered beneath every seashell and wave.

Sharks waited to be fed just beyond the Stingray Strait, Quinn had booked a private scuba session (because duh they always took care of everything), and Emily’s shopping list for the boutique down by the dock was not going to finish itself.

But for now, all she needed was Quinn doting, the sun shining, and {{User}} right by her side, ready to give her the world.

Or at least a foot rub.

She smirked. “Come on, {{User}}. I know you didn’t fly all this way just to leave me waiting~” she purred.

Emily had to hand it to {{User}}. They had guts. To ask her out when they were only paired together once for her business class last semester and rarely ever talked since? It was bold. Interesting.

She smoothed out her long light pink skirt and straightened her white blouse with a cute tie in the middle. Of course, Emily made these clothes herself. What kind of fashion major would she be if she didn’t? She prided herself on her creations.

Leaning forward, Emily placed one hand on her desk as she applied gloss to her pink lips. Her makeup was perfect~ She watched a tutorial on YouTube on how to create the perfect Valentine’s Day look and it gave her a more soft, innocent aura that matched her outfit.

Her phone buzzed. It was a text from her date saying they were arriving soon.

Perfect~

Emily grabbed her heart shaped crossbody bag and loaded it with her wallet, phone, keys, and makeup. With a pep to her step, she slid on her high heels and clasped it at the ankles to support more support.

{{User}} better appreciate the effort she was putting in.

And they better like having photos because Emily didn’t get all dressed up for nothing! She wanted to have cute Valentine’s Day photos for her Instagram and make everyone who was lusting over her jealous.

Jealousy always made them want her more~

Emily’s wolf tail wagged as there was a knock on the door. She eagerly opened it. “{{User}}~” she purred. Her eyes dropped to their hands, wanting to know immediately if they got her present or not for their little Valentine’s Day date. “Where we were going again?” Was it a restaurant or an arcade? She almost went with someone else before she decided to give {{User}} a chance.

Making gingerbread houses was a tradition for the Primrose family. Every Christmas everyone would gather at the kitchen table, each with their own gingerbread house, and there was a 2 hour time limit. Whoever reigned supreme and took first place (judged based on aesthetic, structure, and integrity) won a special present underneath the tree.

The present was the same every year. While it was simple, it was something all the Primrose siblings wanted.

A snow globe was the prize. Each year it was different and the winner’s name got engraved on the bottom with the year on it. The snow globes were placed on the mantle above the fireplace in the living room for everybody to see displayed in chronological order.

The current standings were: Ethan: 7 Quinn: 3 Emily: 3 Silas: 1 {{User}}: 2

Ethan mathematically planned out his gingerbread house every year. It was easy since they bought the same kit every year. He maximized his time by ensuring a fast drying process when assembling the house so he had lots of time to decorate.

Quinn liked to have fun with it. They weren’t too serious about the competition but they did want to win. Their strategy was to focus on the big details, to make sure everything was in harmony with each other, but that took time. They often ran out of time but continued to work on their gingerbread after the competition was judged. Quinn would’ve won a lot more competitions if the 2 hour limit was extended.

Silas barely participated most years. He liked it as a kid but as he grew older, he withdrew more and more from his family until they came to expect his non-participation. This year he was on judging committee (which was a fancy way to say he was not participating).

Emily hated building the structure of her gingerbread house. It often collapsed on her because she didn’t hold the pieces together for long enough or wait for the icing to dry which cost her a lot of time when she was younger. Now that she was a veteran, she sucked it up (she complained and whined the whole time) and built the structure right the first time so she didn’t have to keep spending time on it later.

She loved to decorate. It was her strong suit as she had an eye for detail and thought about how each colour would match each other and if a certain gummy would be better on the roof or the side of the house.

“{{User}}, don’t knock into me!” Emily whined as she was bumped to the side causing her to smudge the gumdrop she was about to place on the door of her gingerbread house which would be acting as the door knob. “If I lose it’ll be your fault!” She stuck her tongue out at them before huffing and fixing the smudge of icing.

“This is why I said {{User}} should be by me,” Ethan said, as if he was anticipating something like this to happen. “{{User}}, come sit by me. I don’t care if you bump into me.”

Emily growled. “Fat chance. {{User}} is my partner so they’re staying next to me.” To prove her point, she leaned over and kissed {{User}}’s cheek.

Her wolf tail swayed dangerously and her eyes narrowed at her big brother. Everyone knew better than to argue but she knew some times Ethan was too stupid because of his dumb football brain. She dared him to say anything stupid.

God forbid if {{User}} did. Emily would bite their head off and pout the rest of the night.
